Jiho Jun

Student

Hello, I’m Jiho Jun from South Korea.
I’m a freshman at Seoul National University (SNU).
This blog is my personal journal where I record my studies and life experiences—so I can look back on what I’ve learned and thought along the way.

Publications

Dec 2022

Minimum Potential Problem at Specific Boundary Conditions by Jiho Jun and Yongje Lee

Numerical computations to find the n-dimensional equivalent of the catenary, as well as to explore the minimal-potential problem of two-dimensional surfaces with various boundaries.

Nov 2022

The Method Determining Dyson Slingshot Trajectory of a Spacecraft Following a Rectilinear Path Using Dynamic Discrete Gradient Descent by Myeong Yoon, Jiho Jun et al

The way to find the most efficient slingshot trajectory at the binary-star system, using DDGD (Dynamic Discrete Gradient Descent).

Dec 2023

Solitons in a Trapped Bose-Einstein Condensate: Breathers Approaching to Stationary Solution by Myeong Yoon, Jiho Jun

Developed Potential Growing Method from SSFM(Split-Step Fourier Method) to find the soliton solutions of the Gross-Pitaevskii equation, and the numerical computations to find the breather solutions of the equation.

Dec 2023

Dynamical Color Correction for Color Vision Deficiency by Junseok Lee, Jiho Jun et al

Image re-coloring algorithm for both color vision deficiency and normal vision, using color potential model and interpolation.
